description: Switzerland isn't an European Union member, but still benefits from the charter. Official members say the country is cherry-picking which laws to follow.

contentencoded:
The European Union is trying to figure out what to do with a non-member in their midst, after voters in Switzerland passed a referendum to puts limits on the number of foreigners who can live and work there.  The BBC's Imogen Foulks joined us from Geneva to tell us more.

Click play above to hear more.
title: EU officials debate sanctions after Switzerland restricts immigration
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Tuesday, February 11, 2014
teaser: Switzerland isn't an European Union member, but still benefits from the charter. Official members say the country is cherry-picking which laws to follow.
